Articles.Content: At the very top of the Control Tower at the abandoned island airbase (within the tower itself, so you must walk up the stairs) is a control seat. If you board it, your Kerbal will be whisked underground to the main section of Kerbal society, and a special cutscene will play.
If you need that added kick in the pants on liftoff, add some LV-N Motors for extra thrust!
Liquid fuel is not approved for use in vacuum - if you want to fly outside of the atmosphere you are restricted to solid fuel!
The Kraken is your friend. Try to meet with him as much as possible
Switch SCE to Kraken.
hold F9 to quicksave and F5 to load the quicksave
If you find yourself repeatedly crashing, keep it up! It means you are getting closer to unlocking advanced landing gear.
gilly is great for jumping as kerbals especially without fuel
Using 2.5m engines on 1.25m fuel tanks gets great TWR. Use this configuration for more powerful rockets.
The more you craft wobbles, the better!!
Better everywhere than everywhere

Listen to this song while reentering and you'll get an achievement.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Vi35XQjFV_A

I just confused you into doing something awesome.

Edited June 3, 2014 by Guest
in dead indeed inn d'id
The height counter on top of the screen? That is the height above the ground, not sea level.
Remember; always point the rocket towards the ground. The top will flip open and give you extra thrust.
When doing a retrograde burn, point yourself towards the yellow market with no x in it.
You found already the UFO between the Mun and Minimus?
Start a 90Ã‚Â° gravity turn at approximatley 100m up.
The LV-1 is so overpowered that you're better off using clusters of them instead of any other engine.
Never turn on SAS when flying. Your rocket is going to flip.
Remember: The MÃƒÂ¼n's surface is jelly. Even at high speeds, you can safely bounce on the surface with no damage done to your craft.
If you put the biggest engine under the smallest tank, you will get A LOT of speed because of your low weight.
Landing on your feet is the best way to save a Kerbal from fast falling.
remember kerbals come with parachutes by default
Transmitting science back to Kerbin is the way to go, it's never worthwhile to do a return mission.
